title: Content 4 - xAIO Analysis (Buffered Panels)

fields.label: xAIO Analysis JSON (Canonical)
fields.name: aio_analysis_json
fields.instructions:
Store the full AI output as a single JSON object (canonical source of truth).
Include support_spans (sentence IDs like s12-s14) for traceability.

fields.label: xAIO Schema Version
fields.name: aio_schema_version
fields.instructions: Set to the schema version used by your extractor prompt (e.g., 0.1.0).

fields.label: xAIO Generated At
fields.name: aio_generated_at
fields.instructions: Timestamp when the AI extraction was generated (UTC recommended).

fields.label: Summary (One-liner)
fields.name: aio_summary_one_liner
fields.instructions:
Neutral summary <= 35 words. No opinions.
Prompt cue: Write a one-sentence neutral summary of what the text is about.

fields.label: Source Type (As classified)
fields.name: aio_signal_source_type
fields.instructions: Classify by how it reads: news/gov/ngo/opinion/social/other.

fields.label: Evidence Density (Text-only)
fields.name: aio_signal_evidence_density
fields.instructions: Estimate from quotes, named sources, documents/data, methods described.

fields.label: Dispute Level (Text-internal)
fields.name: aio_signal_dispute_level_text_internal
fields.instructions: Rate based on explicit contestation/uncertainty language in the text.

fields.label: Anonymous Sourcing Usage
fields.name: aio_signal_anonymous_sourcing_usage
fields.instructions: None/Limited/Heavy based on the text.

fields.label: Entities (Global)
fields.name: aio_entities
fields.instructions: Extract key people/orgs/governments/groups/locations mentioned in the text. Include support_spans.

sub_fields.label: Support Spans
sub_fields.name: support_spans
sub_fields.instructions: Sentence IDs or char offsets showing where this entity appears.

fields.label: 1) Speech-act / Intent (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_01_intent_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) describing what the text is trying to do (speech-act), not whether it is true.
End with a small parse block for downstream parsing.
Required ending format:
[PARSE]
primary_intent=<one of: reporting|explaining|arguing|warning_forecasting|justifying_excusing|attacking_defending_reputation|mobilizing_call_to_action>
secondary_intents=<comma list or none>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
needs_verification=<none or short phrase>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 2) Narrative / Story Spine (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_02_story_spine_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) summarizing the narrative spine and causal story AS PRESENTED.
Include: central conflict, turning point/why it matters, root cause (as presented), solution path (as presented).
End with:
[PARSE]
central_conflict=<short>
turning_point=<short>
root_cause_as_presented=<short>
solution_path_as_presented=<short>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 3) Definitions & Category Choices (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_03_definitions_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) describing key terms/labels and how the author implicitly defines or uses them.
Include notable category assignments (who counts as what) and any equivalences (X~Y) that steer interpretation.
End with:
[PARSE]
key_terms=<comma list up to 10>
category_assignments_hint=<short>
equivalences_hint=<short>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 4) Evidence Posture & Sourcing Style (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_04_evidence_posture_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) describing HOW the text treats evidence (not verifying it).
Cover: attribution (how often claims are sourced), hedging vs certainty, implied proof standard, verification moves shown, anonymous sourcing usage.
End with:
[PARSE]
attribution_degree=<low|med|high>
hedging_level=<low|med|high>
certainty_language_level=<low|med|high>
implied_proof_standard=<journalistic_balance|courtroom|activist_moral|mixed|unclear>
verification_moves=<comma list or none>
anonymous_sources_usage=<none|limited|heavy>
evidence_gaps_hint=<short>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 5) Uncertainty, Unknowns & Disputed Terrain (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_05_uncertainty_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) summarizing what the text itself marks as unclear/unknown/unconfirmed, and any explicit disputes (A says X, B says not-X).
Do not add outside knowledge.
End with:
[PARSE]
unknowns_count=<0-12>
disputed_points_count=<0-12>
missing_data_flags_hint=<short>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
needs_verification=<none or short phrase>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 6) Omissions & Selection Effects (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_06_omissions_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) describing measurable coverage gaps WITHOUT mind-reading.
Cover: whose voices are quoted vs absent, evidence types present vs plausibly expected but absent, time-window selection, alternative hypotheses not addressed, open questions.
End with:
[PARSE]
quoted_stakeholders_hint=<comma list up to 8 or none>
absent_stakeholders_hint=<comma list up to 8 or none>
evidence_types_present=<comma list: documents|data|video|audio|none>
evidence_types_absent=<comma list or none>
time_window_selection=<short or none>
open_questions_count=<5-15 or 0>
confidence=<low|med|high>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 7) Rhetoric, Framing & Persuasion Mechanics (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_07_rhetoric_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) describing rhetoric/framing signals neutrally.
Cover: dominant frames, tone, persuasion devices (e.g., moral language, authority cues), anecdote vs aggregate balance, any loaded language.
End with:
[PARSE]
tone=<neutral|alarmed|empathetic|hostile|advocacy|mixed>
dominant_frames=<comma list: security|humanitarian|legal|economic|cultural|political|other>
persuasion_devices=<comma list or none>
anecdote_vs_aggregate=<anecdote_heavy|balanced|data_heavy|unclear>
loaded_language_hint=<comma list up to 10 or none>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 8) Normative Layer: Values & Prescriptions (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_08_normative_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) separating descriptive claims from normative content.
Extract value judgments (good/bad, justified/unjustified), prescriptions (what should happen), and implied moral framework.
End with:
[PARSE]
value_judgments_count=<0+>
prescriptions_count=<0+>
moral_frameworks=<comma list: rights_based|security_based|utilitarian|virtue|other|mixed>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 9) Predictions & Commitments (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_09_predictions_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) capturing forecasts and conditional statements that could be revisited later, plus any actor commitments reported.
End with:
[PARSE]
predictions_count=<0-12>
commitments_count=<0-12>
dominant_time_horizon=<days|weeks|months|years|unspecified>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 10) Actor Map & Responsibility Attributions (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_10_actor_map_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) describing the actor model AS PRESENTED.
Include: key actors, roles (initiator/retaliator/victim/mediator/etc.), relationships (ally/adversary/command), and responsibility attributions (blame/credit/causation/legal responsibility) as claimed.
End with:
[PARSE]
key_actors_hint=<comma list up to 10>
roles_hint=<short>
relationships_hint=<short>
responsibility_attributions_count=<0+>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 11) Internal Consistency (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_11_internal_consistency_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) checking ONLY for within-text issues (no external fact-checking).
Look for timeline inconsistencies, numerical mismatches, definition drift, or contradictions.
End with:
[PARSE]
issues_count=<0-10>
most_severe_type=<timeline|number|definition|contradiction|none>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
[/PARSE]

fields.label: 12) Falsifiability: What Would Change My Mind? (Buffer)
fields.name: aio_panel_12_falsifiability_buffer
fields.instructions:
AI output (1–2 paragraphs) listing 1–5 major theses in the text and what evidence would materially update or disconfirm each.
Mark this as analytic scaffolding.
End with:
[PARSE]
theses_count=<1-5 or 0>
top_thesis_hint=<short>
confidence=<low|med|high>
support_spans=<comma sentence IDs or none>
needs_verification=<none or short phrase>
[/PARSE]

description: xAIO: lightweight, single-call panel buffers (1–12) + global signals/entities. Intended for later parsing/enrichment.
